query: What is ACL student research workshop?
output: The ACL Student Research Workshop (SRW) is a forum organized by ACL 2023, aimed at bringing together students investigating various areas of Computational Linguistics, Natural Language Processing, and Machine Learning. The workshop provides students at multiple stages of their education, including undergraduate, MSc/MA, junior and senior PhD students, the opportunity to present their work, receive mentorship and get valuable feedback from the international research community. The goal is to aid students in getting familiar with conducting and presenting their research.

query: What is the new award policy implemented by ACL2023?
output: The new award policy implemented by ACL2023 aims for broader recognition of exceptional research, in particular by significantly increasing the pool of outstanding papers to 1.5-2.5% of the total submissions. This meant that they had a total of 3 best papers, 4 special awards papers (Resource Award, Social Impact Award, Reproduction Award, Theme Paper Award), and 39 outstanding papers. Additionally, there are Area Chair Awards where the Senior Area Chairs of each track had the opportunity to nominate one of their papers for a separate award.

query: What are the responsibilities of the organizers of the accepted proposals?
output: The organizers of the accepted proposals are responsible for publicizing and running the workshop, reviewing submissions, producing the camera-ready workshop proceedings, organizing the meeting days, and ensuring that all participants are aware of ACL’s anti-harassment policy. They must also commit to all deadlines, and cannot accept submissions for publication that will be (or have been) published elsewhere. They are free to set their own policies on simultaneous submission and review. The organizers also need to follow the timelines for submission and reviewing of workshop papers, and the preparation of camera-ready copies. They should not deviate from the schedule unless absolutely necessary, and with explicit agreement from the relevant Workshop Chairs.

query: How can I contact industry track chairs?
output: You can contact the Industry Track Chairs at ACL2023 via the group email acl-2023-industry-track-pcs@googlegroups.com. The individual emails for the chairs are bbeigmanklebanov@ets.org for Beata Beigman Klebanov, Sunayana.Sitaram@microsoft.com for Sunayana Sitaram, and jasondwilliams@gmail.com for Jason Williams.

query: What is the main focus of the Industry Track of ACL 2023?
output: The main focus of the Industry Track of ACL 2023 is on papers that advance the understanding of practical issues related to the deployment of language processing technologies in non-trivial real-world systems. The track provides an opportunity to highlight key insights and new research challenges from real world implementations. It invites submissions describing innovations and implementations in all areas of speech and natural language processing technologies and systems relevant to real-world applications.

query: What is Computational Linguistics?
output: Computational linguistics is the scientific study of language from a computational perspective. Computational linguists are interested in providing computational models of various kinds of linguistic phenomena. These models may be “knowledge-based” (“hand-crafted”) or “data-driven” (“statistical” or “empirical”). Work in computational linguistics is in some cases motivated from a scientific perspective in that one is trying to provide a computational explanation for a particular linguistic or psycholinguistic phenomenon; and in other cases the motivation may be more purely technological in that one wants to provide a working component of a speech or natural language system. The work of computational linguists is incorporated into many working systems today, including speech recognition systems, text-to-speech synthesizers, automated voice response systems, web search engines, text editors, language instruction materials, among others.

query: What is the cancelation policy of regisration?
output:
The cancellation policy of registration for ACL2023 is as follows: 

- If you cancel your registration one month or more prior to the conference, which is by June 9, 2023, you will be refunded the full amount you paid, minus up to a $50 processing fee.

- Cancellations made up to three weeks prior to the conference, meaning by June 16, 2023, will result in a refund of the ACL membership (if it was paid as part of the registration) and any amounts paid beyond the first $200.

- If you cancel two weeks prior to the start of the conference, which is by June 23, 2023, or do not show up, you will not be refunded any amount. However, you can retain the current full year ACL membership (if it was paid as part of the registration) and have virtual access to the event.

Exceptions to these rules are for cancellations due to governmental travel restrictions, failure to obtain a visa, or a serious illness that prevents travel to the conference. In these cases, you will be refunded the full amount paid, minus up to a $50 processing fee, regardless of when the notification is received by the ACL Office. You must, however, submit documentation proving these circumstances.
